For this discussion you were required to read [Measuring the Prevalence of Questionable Research Practices With Incentives for Truth Telling](https://doi.org/10.1177/0956797611430953) and [Reproducibility and replicability](../posts/repro-repli.qmd).

Use the following image for inspiration and check the prompts below. Ask us if you have any questions and/or search online!

![](../img/res-process-cycle-qrps.png)


::: callout-note
#### Prompts

- Which part of a research study do you believe should be beyond the control of the researcher?
  1. Research questions/hypotheses.
  2. Study design.
  3. Results
  
- Which part of a research study do you believe is most important for advancing a researcher's career?
  1. Research questions/hypotheses.
  2. Study design.
  3. Results
  
  
- What can be done to de-incentivise questionable research practices (QRPs)?
:::
